sources.title: Don't Look in the Basement
sources.description: MPEG2 Rip from Mill Creek's Gore and More 10 Movie Pack Note: This is the "uncut" version which contains nudity.

sources.title: Dont Look In The Basement 1973 202312
sources.description: Nurse Charlotte Beale (Rosie Holotik) is hired by Dr. Stephens (Michael Harvey) to work at a small sanitarium he runs. When Charlotte arrives, however, she learns that Stephens has died in the interim, and that she'll be taking orders from new president Dr. Masters (Anne MacAdams). Charlotte goes al ong, but can't help noticing how unusual Masters' approach is to treating the mentally ill. They're allowed free run of the place, and Charlotte begins to wonder if Masters isn't a patient herself.

sources.title: Don't Look in the Basement
sources.description: Nurse Charlotte Beale arrives at the isolated Stephens Sanitarium to work, only to learn that Dr. Stephens was murdered by one of the patients and his successor, Dr. Geraldine Masters, is not very eager to take on new staff. Charlotte finds her job maddeningly hard as the patients torment and harass her at every turn, and she soon learns why Dr. Masters is so eager to keep outsiders out.

sources.title: Don't Look in the Basement (1973) DRIVE-IN HORROR
sources.description:
Movie Class by PizzaFLIX: The drive-in Theater became popular in rural areas during the 1940s and peaked in the late 1950s. With the competition of VCRs and video rental, by the 1970s attendance was in decline. To remain viable many venues switched from showing family-friendly fare to genre films appealing to teenagers. This independent horror movie directed by S. F. Brownrigg is a PizzaFLIX favorite and became a cult hit at the Drive-In 1973. 

Stars: Bill McGhee, Jessie Lee Fulton, Robert Dracup
Director: S.F. Brownrigg
Writer: Tim Pope

When a young psychiatric nurse goes to work at a lonesome asylum, she experiences varying degrees of torment from the patients.

metadata.Plot: Nurse Charlotte Beale arrives at the isolated Stephens Sanitarium to work, only to learn that Dr. Stephens was murdered by one of the patients and his successor, Dr. Geraldine Masters, is not very eager to take on new staff. Charlotte finds her job maddeningly hard as the patients torment and harass her at every turn, and she soon learns why Dr. Masters is so eager to keep outsiders out.
metadata.Actors: Bill McGhee, Jessie Lee Fulton, Robert Dracup
